title: Foreign participation in federal biddings: A quantitative approach using the procurement panel. (arXiv:2303.14447v1 [econ.GN])
abstract: The bidding is the Public Administration's administrative process and other designated persons by law to select the best proposal, through objective and impersonal criteria, for contracting services and purchasing goods. In times of globalization, it is common for companies seeking to expand their business by participating in biddings. Brazilian legislation allows the participation of foreign suppliers in bids held in the country. Through a quantitative approach, this article discusses the weight of foreign suppliers' involvement in federal bidding between 2011 and 2018. To this end, a literature review was conducted on public procurement and international biddings. Besides, an extensive data search was achieved through the Federal Government Procurement Panel. The results showed that between 2011 and 2018, more than R\$ 422.6 billion was confirmed in public procurement processes, and of this total, about R\$ 28.9 billion was confirmed to foreign suppliers. translated_title: 外国企业参与联邦招标：采购面板的量化方法
translated_abstract: 招标是公共行政部门和法律规定的其他人通过客观和不偏体的标准来选择最佳建议以签订服务和采购商品的行政流程。在全球化的时代，公司通常通过参加招标来寻求业务扩张。巴西法律允许外国供应商参加在该国举行的投标活动。通过量化方法，本文讨论了2011年至2018年间外国供应商参与联邦招标的作用。为此，进行了关于公共采购和国际招标的文献评论。此外，通过联邦政府采购面板实现了广泛的数据搜索。结果显示，在2011年至2018年间，已确认了超过4226亿雷亚尔的公共采购流程，其中约289亿雷亚尔确认给了外国供应商。卫生部占据了其中的一大部分。
tldr: 本篇论文通过量化的方法研究了2011年至2018年外国供应商在巴西联邦招标中的作用以及其对国内企业的影响。
